message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CY

This paper deals with sentiment analysis, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP). The paper discusses the creation and evaluation of sentiment lexica, which involves statistical modeling and machine learning techniques. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with NLP and related topics. The paper also involves probabilistic models, which suggests that it could belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper discusses the evaluation of automatically created lexica, which involves artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and information retrieval (cs.IR) techniques. Finally, the paper could also belong to cs.CY (Computers and Society), as it discusses the use of sentiment analysis in psychology and social sciences.
